metadata.title: CVE-2018-17937 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: gpsd versions 2.90 to 3.17 and microjson versions 1.0 to 1.3, an opensource project, allow a stack-based buffer overflow, which may allow remoteattackers to execute arbitrary code on embedded platforms via traffic onPort 2947/TCP or crafted JSON inputs.

criterions.comment: gpsd: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
